section.section:
After the end of each fiscal year, the Bureau shall submit to the Board a report that:
contains an itemized statement of the State revenues from all sources for that fiscal year; and
includes any recommendations of the Bureau.

In December, March, and September of each year, the Bureau shall submit to the Board a report that contains an itemized statement of the estimated State revenues from all sources for the fiscal year following the fiscal year in which the report is made.
The Bureau shall provide to the Board any other information that the Board requests.

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the reports required under paragraphs (1) and (2) of this subsection shall include an itemized statement of:
revenues or estimated revenues distributed to the Transportation Trust Fund, including the motor fuel taxes imposed under Title 9, Subtitle 3 of the Tax - General Article and motor vehicle titling taxes imposed under Title 13, Subtitle 8 of the Transportation Article; and
revenues from the State transfer tax imposed under Title 13, Subtitle 2 of the Tax - Property Article.

text.section:
In addition to these reports, the Bureau shall continually conduct studies of State revenue sources to:
determine the amount of revenue produced; and
devise and recommend new methods and sources for improved efficiency, equity, and economy in production, collection, and estimation of revenue.

section.section: On or before December 1, 2008, and December 1 of every third year thereafter, the Bureau shall submit to the Governor and, in accordance with § 2-1246 of the State Government Article, to the General Assembly a tax incidence study measuring the burden of all the major taxes imposed by the State and how that burden is shared among taxpayers of different income levels.
The Bureau shall prepare and submit the statistics of income report required under § 10-223 of the Tax - General Article.
